SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . To gather preliminary outcome data enhance quitline-based smoking cessation intervention adapt outpatient oncology set support future grant application . II . To evaluate change primary patient report outcome , include quality life ( quantified Functional Assessment Cancer Therapy - Lung [ FACT-L ] European Organization Research Treatment Cancer Quality Life Questionnaire - Lung Cancer Module [ EORTC QLQ LC13 ] ) , perceive life stress ( quantify Perceived Stress Scale ) , depression ( quantified Center Epidemiological Studies Short Depression Scale [ CESD-10 ] ) , lung cancer patient intervention control condition ( control arm close accrual 3/6/2012 ) baseline 3-months following randomization . OUTLINE : Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . ARM I ( close accrual 3/6/2012 ) : Patients receive personalize letter physician advice quit smoke copy National Cancer Institute 's `` Cleaning Air '' smoke cessation booklet . ARM II : Patients receive personalize letter smoke cessation booklet . Patients also receive 8-week supply nicotine replacement patch undergo counsel session 30-45 minute train nurse midlevel provider focus benefit quit smoke cancer patient address cancer-specific concern smoke cessation . Patients also undergo quitline-based smoking cessation intervention comprise 5 individual 25- 30-minute telephone counseling session unlimited inbound phone-based access Quit Coaches 8-11 week , mail write material , interactive online program . After completion study treatment , patient follow 3 month .
